Comment: > While the Midwest governor said he would like to think he was chosen by Harris because of his record delivering “amazing progressive things in Minnesota,” he acknowledged a large part of him being on the ticket was to connect with white swing-state voters.  > “I could code talk to white guys watching football, fixing their truck, doing that, that I could put them at ease,” Walz said at the event Monday.  > “I was the permission structure to say, ‘Look you can do this and vote for this,’” he added.  “Permission structure” is exactly the kind of term an elite consultant comes up with to explain why it’s critical we send Hillary on a black podcast to brag about hot sauce she carries everywhere to secure black voters. “The public needs someone’s permission to support this” and we wonder why they call us elitist lol  Maybe running on Walz’s genuinely progressive agenda that sounds good to people even without someone else’s permission would’ve been a good idea. Also, let’s not forget reporting that showed Harris didn’t want a VP to outshine her… something that’s ironically happening now anyways
Author: Prior_Coyote_4376

Comment: The Hillary Clinton hot sauce thing pisses me off to this day. It backfired so spectacularly, and I find that so upsetting because it was genuine. Her consistent and undying love of hot sauce was a known thing, like in news articles, all the way back when her husband was president.    Her husband plays the saxophone on Arsenio Hall and gets lovingly referred to as the first black president for years. She truthfully answers a question and gets shit on for being disingenuous and pandering for the next decade.    Bill unquestionably has more charisma than Hillary, and I get that, but it still pisses me off.
Author: kittenpantzen

Comment: The fucking nitpicking on the left of the left is ridiculous. The guy on the other side told us in a debate that Haitian immigrants were going to stalk your pets and eat them. Meanwhile, the left has to have a candidate between the ages of 35 and 45, not a female but also not a white male, has to be perfectly candid and genuine but at the same time never say anything uncomfortable, be progressive and a centrist at the same time… fuck this shit. There were two candidates and one was serious and the other wasn’t. We sit here making excuses about why the unserious candidate won, but never admit that maybe the ELECTORATE wasn’t serious. We’re getting what we deserve. This was our fault. This notion that the Kamala campaign had to be more perfect when she was running against a convicted felon spewing conspiracy theories is ridiculous.

Comment: Everyone here upset about this doesn’t understand that this is how people think. You can get mad about the focus group style shit but it’s true. A massive population is made up of demographic groups and those groups can be moved in certain ways. Some of them are so hard wired to resist certain things (like voting for a black woman) that they need to see other white dudes support one to feel comfortable.   You can be annoyed that people think like this but it’s dumb to not take advantage of it.

Comment: > they need to see other white dudes  that they actually trust on their own merits. Just the sight of a white dude doesn’t change anyone’s mind. It’s not as if they want to vote for Harris but can’t until they see Walz. They don’t trust the entire agenda.  If Walz wins them over on his own merits as a more progressive masculine figure first, *then* his appearance has value to those who would be reluctant to support Harris just for being a black woman. Instead Walz is more active and effective now as a media figure without the campaign holding him back. He never got the chance to win trust as someone with a vision of improving lives.   The elitist assumption that average Americans are so dumb they automatically align with those who have the same identity is just a different kind of stereotypical prejudice. It’s what leads Joe Biden to say “you ain’t black” if you don’t vote for him. It’s genuinely confusing for these people to understand why any voter might be more complicated than that, so they have no idea why they’re losing.
Author: Prior_Coyote_4376
